text: Anyone know how to re-precompile a package in julia 1.6.0 rc?

elements.text: Anyone know how to re-precompile a package in julia 1.6.0 rc?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
Becaused it failed? Try to invoke it again with `pkg> precompile` maybe?

text: I am specifically trying to re-precompile <https://juliagpu.gitlab.io/CUDA.jl/usage/memory/#Environment-variables|CUDA with changed environment variables>.  `pkg> precompile`  seems to do nothing in my case: I believe it only precompiles packages that obviously need recompiling (after adding or update). The only thing that seems to work is removing the  `~/.julia/compiled/v1.6/CUDA`  directory.

text: Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/54943| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
That had not worked either: also seemed to do nothing

elements.text: That had not worked either: also seemed to do nothing

text: I believe deleting the compiled directory is the only way. This will probably not be necessary in Julia 1.6 and later since there is a new system for preferences in the works.

elements.text: I believe deleting the compiled directory is the only way. This will probably not be necessary in Julia 1.6 and later since there is a new system for preferences in the works.
